intro: Dichapetalum ubangiense, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its striking, bright red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has simple, opposite leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often found in savannas and woodland areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and parks for its vibrant floral display.
